original: Beronius, Otto Harald Ingemar, stadsläkare, Hjo, f. 4/12/01 i Brevik, Skarab. 1., av domkyrkosysslom. Per B. o. Eda Svennius. G. 1. 30 m. Rut Davidson, d. 36; 2. 37 m. Anna Greta Hjorth. Barn: Marianne f. 33, Per 35, Gunhild 39, Rolf 40, Birgitta 42. — Stud:ex. i Skara 20, med. kand. i Upps. 26 o. med. lic. där 32. Bitr. läk. v. Sätra brunn 23-26, e. läk. där 27, assist :läk. resp. tf. aman. v. bröstklin. i Upps. 32, assist :läk. v. med. klin. där s. å. samt v. Sahlgr. sjukh. med. avd. 32-33, tf. und :läk. v. Kristianstads las. med. avd. 33-34, assist :läk. v. S:t Eriks sjukh. röntgenavd. 34, undrläk. v. Skellefteå las. med. avd. 34-36, andre undrläk. v. Mariestadsi las. 36, tf. stadsläk. i Hjo 37, ord. dito sed. 38, läk. v. Skarab. 1. landstings sjuk- o. vårdhem, SjÖTyd, Hjo, samt pö^st- o. telegr :’làk. Led. av hälsov :ndn o. bar-nav:nd:n, ordf. i Hjo-kretsen av SvRK sed. 44.
translated: Beronius, Otto Harald Ingemar, city doctor, Hjo. Born on December 4th, 1901 in Brevik, Skaraborg County. 1st son of cathedral verger Per B. and Eda Svennius. Married 1st in 1930 to Rut Davidson (died in 1936); 2nd in 1937 to Anna Greta Hjorth. Children: Marianne born in 1933, Per in 1935, Gunhild in 1939, Rolf in 1940, and Birgitta in 1942. Studied in Skara and graduated in 1920. Became a medical candidate in Uppsala in 1926 and received a medical license in Uppsala in 1932. Worked as an assistant doctor at Sätra brunn from 1923-1926 and as an extra doctor there in 1927. Additionally worked as an assisting doctor and substitute assistant at the chest clinic in Uppsala in 1932 and as an assisting doctor at the medical clinic there in the same year. Also worked as a medical assistant of the medic division at Sahlgr. hospital in 1932-1933, substitute medical doctor at the medic division in Kristianstad Hospital from 1933-1934, assisting doctor at St. Eric's Hospital's radiology department in 1934, junior doctor at Skellefteå Hospital’s medical division from 1934-1936, 2nd junior doctor at Mariestad Hospital in 1936, temporary city doctor in Hjo in 1937, and regular city doctor in Hjo since 1938. Also worked as a doctor at Skaraborg County's hospital and care center, SjÖTyd, Hjo, and as a postal and telegraph doctor. Member of the Health Committee and Children's Welfare Committee and chairman of the Hjo district of the Swedish Red Cross since 1944.

worksFor.name: Skaraborg County's Hospital and Care Center, SjÖTyd, Hjo
